title: Enemy killed their own teamate
body:
I'm not sure if this is a problem linked to Syndra making it able for a enemy to kill their own teammate, or Rammus.
I launched Syndra's E into the entire enemy team along with 3 Dark Spheres. This resulted in Rammus killing Jax.
http://imgur.com/FkHCQig

replies.body: Rammus forgot to turn Friendly Fire off.
I've heard DOTA has a Denial mechanic, where you kill friendly units to keep the enemy from getting the gold. Rammus is just taking it to the next level.
In Dota, you can execute your own minions when they are about to die, to deny the enemy laner any form of gold or exp.

You can deny your own anything actually, and it only denies half the exp iirc.

You can deny towers, and even allied Heroes! (Or yourself, if you have a move that damages yourself ala Pudge.)

I think you are right about the half exp part.

But I don't recall being able to deny towers doe. who the fuck would do that anyway.

it's a mechanic in Dota and players do this to halve the global gold that the enemy team receives when a tower goes down. It's not like u can use it to throw or anything; ur only allowed to attack ur own tower once its hp falls below 10%
wow that is weird I never knew that. Then again, I played very little DotA before jumping to LoL.

You can actually deny your own teammates if

They have under 5% hp
They are currently under a damage over time effect
The damage over time is going to kill them

So poor Viper has a hard time in high elo games
Why? Whats viper's deal.

Poison on every auto, ult is a super lethal poison.

very skilled players can just whack vipers target in fights and viper gets no gold from the kill

I guess if the opponent is pushing and you don't want them to get the gold
But I dunno

Towers need to be at 25% health to be attacked by a friendly unit, while most things just requires 50%.

The only other exception is with ally heroes. I forget if there's a health threshold, but no matter how low they are you can't attack them ( and therefore try to go for the deny ) unless they have specific debuffs on them - usually, extremely long or powerful DoTs.

Plus anyone can deny themselves to neutrals. You won't give anyone the kill if you die to a jungle camp, even if they damaged you literally half a second ago.

Also worth noting is that a hero, Lich, has a spell that's flat-out creep denial while giving the experience to his team. You pretty much pick him if you ever want to give a specific lead a signficant exp advantage, since you're flat-out removing one creep of experience for your opponent and splitting it between you and the laner.
I thought you can only deny allies by specific abilities (think Oracle), but I could be wrong.

From what I remember, Oracle never had a deny ability, but no one in my MMR ever played him.

A way to deny allies is say Kunkkha ultimate, where it has a mini deaths dance effect on anyone hit, the damage taken the few seconds after gives the kill credit to Kunkkha if it is fatal
Thanks for the info. If there is one thing I really liked about DotA it was the deny mechanic. I would've loved to play the game more, but I just couldn't fully enjoy it with my shitty micro...
I thought you could deny heroes with skills like Pudge, or if they were taking poison damage that would kill them anyway. That might have been patched out long ago, though.

old old old old old old... more old old old (if i remember correctly was on Season 1 ){{champion:41}} E was something like: kill an allied minion to boost you and your ally champs, but then rito removed denial from lol but tryndamere's ult is still the same as far as i know (some changes on pbe but its the same)

Spaghetti code used friendly fire.
It's super effective!
Jax fainted.
[{{champion:33}} sweating nervously]
It's because of syndra E

It's the E.

_"Knocks enemies and Dark Spheres back dealing 70/115/160/205/250 (+40% Ability Power) magic damage to them and any enemies they collide with"_

From my understanding, Rammus got hit by the E. Collided into Jax. Because Rammus was in the effects of Scatter the Weak, he caused damage to Jax.
All I can imagine is Syndra shoving Rammus and Jax getting impaled on Rammus's spikes.
sounds like a coding error.
why doesnt lee sin kick do the same

Yeah looks like Syndra's the problem, I'm sure someone posted a video with something similar on the EUW boards..

Edit:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7LN_eYoV3FY
[Thread](http://boards.euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-reports-eu/j3Uau7A9-minion-gets-the-kill-after-i-slain-azir)

[Another thread](http://boards.euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-reports-eu/xpfutMjl-weird-and-buggy-interaction-between-syndras-wave-and-khazix)

Riot pls :D
I find it strange that Scatter the Weak has this issue but no reports of Lee Sin's ultimate having this issue have surface for however many years he's been out.
killing one's own teammate is amazingly efficient cuz you get the killing gold and u earn the bounty!

Reminds me of when the 6.9 skins were on the PBE.  During the first week or so, picking one of the skins in bots would make it so that every time the wearer got a kill, it would show the last killed champion's icon on the banner and it would not show up on the side of the screen.  Oh and any assists were also not shown.

Syndra E is still so buggy. 

I once tried to last hit blue buff with it, and it just disappeared. Neither my jungler nor I got the buff. The enemy jungler wasn't around. It was just gone.
Might have something to do with {{champion:33}} W mixing with {{champion:134}} E
Rammus has too much swag, Jax couldn't take it
Rammus shell too spikey
wow thats nuts
